TopicTitle: Twitch Thursday: KSPTV to stream KSP 1.0

Articles.Content: <figure data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" class="tmblr-full"><img data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" src="https://36.media.tumblr.com/e6b9796e0425d604ccf4dd4df2733721/tumblr_inline_nna4m58vfY1rr2wit_540.jpg" alt="image"/></figure><p><iframe src="http://www.twitch.tv/ksptv/embed" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" height="378" width="620"></iframe><br/></p><p><br/>Hey everyone! <br/></p><p>Starting this Saturday at 2PM Eastern Time / 18:00 UTC KSPTV will be showing off version 1.0 of Kerbal Space Program!</p><p>A large cast of special guests will complement the lineup of your favorite KSPTV streamers. Das Valdez, EJ_SA, ShimmyTheJJ, Scott Manley, MatoroIgnika, RoninPawn and many others will keep you company over the weekend.</p><p>Be there!<br/></p>
WHoah! PREVIEWS!
YES! I can't wait to see at least some of new cool parts and IVA's.
Das *and* Scott? OP.
Meh. Twitch? Could you co-release the preview vids at the same time so that we don't have to watch twitch?
Will the stream recording be posted to YouTube?
Yeah. Twitch is acting funny.

Arg, I have a bowling thing that I may or may not have to do at that time. Actually no wait, I'd have to go during that time.

Sounds awesome though!
MatoroIgnika is doing 1.0 prior to release? That is news, he doesn't usually do pre-release stuff.
Actually, no wait, it's just starting then and continuing through the weekend.

MatoroIgnika is doing 1.0 prior to release? That is news, he doesn't usually do pre-release stuff.

Quoting him, he has access to the experimentals, but haven't played them. So I assume he is going blind for Saturday
Whelp, I better organise Sunday off then.
I probably wont watch it, I really want to have an intimate moment with 1.0
Please make sure to release videos to Youtube immediately after the Twitch session. Twitch has severe performance issues in my location.
YAY! I can't WAIT to see the stuff that ends up on YouTube from this.
Oh coo-OMG EJ? I am SO watching this!

I probably wont watch it, I really want to have an intimate moment with 1.0

You've just burned a really bad image into my brain!
You can watch previous streams on twitch. They dont have to be live

You can watch previous streams on twitch. They dont have to be live

You can; I cannot. Twitch simply does not work here, and as evidenced by the comments upthread, I am far from alone in that experience.

Apart from their atrocious data security (http://www.theregister.co.uk/2015/03/23/twitch_hacked/) and hamfisted approach to IP enforcement (https://www.techdirt.com/articles/20140806/16582228133/twitch-begins-silencing-videos-with-audible-magic-making-everyone-worse-off-because-copyright-law-sucks.shtml), they're also just bloody awful from a technical video streaming point of view.

Squad, can we please get this simulcast on Youtube? A large proportion of your audience are simply unable to view it otherwise.

Edited April 24, 2015 by Wanderfound

Squad, can we please get this simulcast on Youtube? A large proportion of your audience are simply unable to view it otherwise.

I think that's part of the hype machine. Releasing tidbits here and there to select audiences seems to be a thing with squad. So saying that not everyone can access X or Y doesn't register with them as much of a problem. (I too also take issue with Twitch's total lack of security.)

You can watch previous streams on twitch. They dont have to be live

Yeah I was mostly just getting a dig in on Twitch. I'll actually be using a downloader to get the file local so I can watch it using a civilized method.
Where can one find the video version of the livestream?

I think that's part of the hype machine. Releasing tidbits here and there to select audiences seems to be a thing with squad. So saying that not everyone can access X or Y doesn't register with them as much of a problem. (I too also take issue with Twitch's total lack of security.)

Well that is just a wee bit rubbish.

Livestreams of KSP are so awfull to watch, there is no editing or time acceleration. It would be way better to present the new features in a compact video than a few hours livestream thing with bad performance. Twitch is so awfull, i cant watch it without buffering and i have a 128000kbit/sec bandwith.
Finally.
